title: Drawing, Stirrup making [Staphae, sive Stapedes], ca. 1590
medium: Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Scene outside a stirrup maker's shop.  In the foreground, a man is mounting his horse.  At left, a woman holds stirrups suspended by their straps.  The interior of the shop, showing the process of making stirrups, visible at left.  Another figure on horseback at right.  

Bottom left: "Straffano"  The stirrup maker.

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Stirrup making [Staphae, sive Stapedes], ca. 1590. Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-300
